meanings.definition: A small raised area on a surface.
meanings.sent1: I felt a bump on the road as we drove over it.
meanings.sent2: The bump on his head was starting to swell.
meanings.sent3: The bump on the table made it wobble slightly.
meanings.sent4: The bump in the carpet tripped me up.
meanings.sent5: The bump on the tree bark looked like a tiny hill.

meanings.sent1: He gave the door a gentle bump with his hip to open it.
meanings.sent2: The bump on the table made the glass of water shake.
meanings.sent3: The bump on the headboard made a soft thud.
meanings.sent4: The bump of the car hitting the curb startled us.
meanings.sent5: The bump of the ball hitting the wall echoed in the room.

meanings.definition: To move or travel with jerks or jolts.
meanings.sent1: The old car would bump along the bumpy road.
meanings.sent2: The wagon bumped over the rocks in the path.
meanings.sent3: The toy car would bump into the walls when he played with it.
meanings.sent4: The boat bumped against the dock as it tried to moor.
meanings.sent5: The horse-drawn carriage would bump over the cobblestone streets.

meanings.sent1: The soccer ball would bump against the goalpost.
meanings.sent2: The car bumped into the parked vehicle by accident.
meanings.sent3: The shopping cart would bump into people's ankles in the crowded store.
meanings.sent4: The branches would bump against the window during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The bumper cars would bump into each other at the fair.
